title: Marketing Manager (Global Revenue Enablement | Commercial & Partner Marketing)
required_experience:
no_experience_required: False,

description: Title: Marketing Manager (Global Revenue Enablement | Commercial & Partner Marketing)Location: Salt Lake City/ Lehi/ Austin preferredDuration: 7 monthsThis is a hybrid and/or remote position depending on location (Salt Lake City/Lehi/Austin preferred). Hybrid employees can alternate time between both remote and office. Employees in hybrid roles are expected to work from the office 2-3 set days a week (determined by leadership/site), with a general guidepost of being in the office 50% or more of the time based on business needs.Role Overview:We are seeking a dynamic and experienced contractor to join our Client's Acceptance Solutions Commercial and Partner Marketing team as a Marketing Manager for a 6-7-month duration. This role offers the opportunity to manage and execute key marketing activities and contribute to our global revenue enablement and partner marketing strategy.Key Responsibilities:Manage and execute enablement/demand generation and co-marketing activities for our Financial Institution/Acquirers/ISV partners of Client Acceptance Solutions. Examples include development of partner sales enablement material, webinar content and operations, event scripts, campaign assets, and copy for internal/external email marketing.Collaborate with Product Marketing teams, external agencies, and internal stakeholders to develop/edit content, messaging, tools, and resources for partners and their customers in various stages of the buying cycle. This includes power point slide development, templatizing existing content, editing/writing/designing content with cross-functional teams, uploading assets to the partner portal and writing portal/directory onboarding messaging.Support execution and creation where necessary of Partner Portal content deliverables and co-manage the portal relationship in partnership with Global Revenue Enablement team, Product Marketing, Sales Enablement, MarTech teams and external Partner Portal vendor team.Work with creative agency and internal marketing partners to ensure the execution of plan and associated deliverables/marketing components.Ensure partner and company readiness and enablement for events, enablement trainings, preparing documentation, emails, and guidance for smooth delivery and execution of events.Develop and guide social/email content for partner launches in partnership with social and email/digital teams.Work cross-functionally and across Client's regions and markets to scale winning content and GTM activities with regional leads across multi-channel activations and activities for partners where applicable.To be successful the following qualities are preferred:Self-starter and able to stand on their own and partner efficiently and effectively with multiple x-functional stakeholders and leaders.Has passion for executing quickly and effectively with impactful influence to both internal/external partner marketing/agency teams and with great attention to detail.Co-manage creative relationships with agencies and marketing peers at partner organizations with the ability to guide through creative vision and excellent feedback and collaboration.Has a strong strategic mindset, is analytically savvy, leverages data to inform decisions and is relentless in measuring results but can quickly put pen to paper in quick and efficient execution.Deeply understands the changing environment of B2B marketing.Is an outstanding collaborator across cross-functional teams.Has outstanding communication skills and is highly persuasive.Has a track record of successfully working with agencies in the development of marketing programs, content development, including working with content developersBasic Qualifications:8 or more years of relevant work experience with a Bachelor Degree or at least 5 years of experience with an Advanced Degree (e.g. Masters, MBA, JD, MD) or 2 years of work experienceFluent proficiency required in Microsoft stack (PPT, Word, Excel)Comfortable with using software tools and not afraid to be hands on to learn and use new software technology (Wrike project management software, Impartner partner portal navigation etc.)Experience creating documentation and performing training to rollout out new tools or functionality.Systems/process-oriented thinker who loves to organize people and streamline operations.Ability to work independently and manage multiple, complex projects in a fast-paced, global environment; effective at influencing others to achieve goals and outcome with tight timelines.Executor who can deliver multiple projects on time in a fast-paced environment.Bachelor's degree in business or marketingPreferred Qualifications:9 or more years of relevant work experience with a Bachelor Degree or at least 5 years of experience with an Advanced Degree (e.g. Masters, MBA, JD, MD) or 2 years of work experience with a PhDStrong marketing background with 7+ years of experience delivering and executing measurable business results.Comfortable with using software tools and not afraid to be hands on to learn and use new software technology (Wrike project management software, Impartner partner portal navigation etc.)Fluent proficiency required in Microsoft stack (PPT, Word, Excel)Strong strategic thinker focused on end-results who approaches challenges with thoughtfulness, drive, and appropriate urgency.Experience developing and executing B2B marketing campaigns and GTM enablement leveraging internal and external resources.Experience developing strong working relationships with cross-functional partners.Proven track record of success in client-facing roles, ability to influence others and execute fast.Team oriented, collaborative, diplomatic, and flexible, with excellent presentation skills, including strong oral and writing capabilities.Adaptability, flexibility, and professional maturity.Experience and comfort using data to optimize marketing campaigns.Solid understanding and successful implementation and hands on execution of marketing practices (web, email, social, asset/content development, field/event execution and preparation).Experience managing agencies and internal cross-functional organizations.Project management skills and attention to detail.Proficiency in Microsoft PowerPoint, Excel, and Word required.Additional InformationWork Hours: Varies depending on the needs of the department.Travel Requirements: No travel required.Mental/Physical Requirements: This position will be performed in an office setting. The position will require the incumbent to sit and stand at a desk, communicate in person and by telephone, frequently operate standard office equipment, such as telephones and computers.The client is an EEO Employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or protected veteran status. Client will also consider employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with EEOC guidelines and applicable local law.Client will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with applicable local law, including the requirements of Article 49 of the San Francisco Police Code.#TB_EN
highlights:
